help.title: Anscombe-Glynn test of kurtosis
help.body:
Description
Performs Anscombe-Glynn test of kurtosis for normal samples
Usage
anscombe.test(x, alternative = c("two.sided", "less", "greater"))
Arguments
  • x: a numeric vector of data values.
  • y: a character string specifying the alternative hypothesis, must be one of '"two.sided"' (default), '"greater"' or '"less"'. You can specify just the initial letter.
Details
Under the hypothesis of normality, data should have kurtosis equal to 3. This test has such null hypothesis and is useful to detect a significant difference of kurtosis in normally distributed data.
Values
A list with class htest containing the following components:
  • statistic: the list containing kurtosis estimator and its transformation.
  • p.value: pvalue of the test.
  • alternative: a character string describing the alternative hypothesis
  • method: a character string indicating what type of test was performed.
  • data.name: Name of the data argument.
Example
set.seed(1234)
x = rnorm(1000)
kurtosis(x)
anscombe.test(x)
Package
moments
Help
For detailed help click on the R icon on the top right hand side of this dialog overlay or run the following command help(anscombe.test, package ='moments') in the BioStat Prime R editor.
